title: Font from pag.52 of the book "In the Cage: A guide to Sigil", from 1995
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112710im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Font04_pag_5385.52-53-73.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112710im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Font==_5171.png)
  
Maybe this can help the identification: The source is at pag.52 of this old 1995 Planescape  
 [manual](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112710/http:/www.scribd.com/doc/117655597/Planescape-D-D-2nd-In-the-Cage-A-Guide-to-Sigil-OCR)

Font: 

 Octavian 

Solved By: 

 [fvilanakis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112710/http:/typophile.com/user/176276 "View user profile.")
author: Paolo G

comments.content:
It looks like **[Octavian](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112710/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Scriptorium-Fonts&ffam=Octavian%20-%20Regular&fid=e756a0f631e9745bc2772e35e1b873b2&fsize=36&text=ACDEFGHIMOPRS%20are%20charming%20Sleep.%20thou%20Easer%20of%20all%20woes.%20Brother%20to%20death&wrap=2)** by David F. Nalle (Scriptorium Fonts, 1993)

------------------  
I found it using "Find my Font": [http://www.findmyfont.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112710/http:/www.findmyfont.com/ "http://www.findmyfont.com")
